other.title: Other Settings
other.customInstructionsDesc: These instructions are added to the end of the system prompt sent with every request.
other.planActSeparateModels: Use different models for Plan and Act modes
other.planActSeparateModelsDesc: Switching between Plan and Act mode will persist the API and model used in the previous mode. This may be helpful e.g. when using a strong reasoning model to architect a plan for a cheaper coding model to act on.
other.resetStateDesc: This will reset all global state and secret storage in the extension.

feedback.text: If you have any questions or feedback, feel free to open an issue at

api.complexPrompts: Codee uses complex prompts and works best with Claude or deepseek-v3 models. Less capable models may not work as expected.

chat.planModeTooltip: In Plan mode, Codee will gather information to architect a plan
chat.actModeTooltip: In Act mode, Codee will complete the task immediately

welcome.title: Hi, I'm Codee
welcome.description: You need to provide me with a detailed software development requirement description, so that I can break down the requirements into multiple steps for execution. I can view files, modify files, write files, execute commands, etc. I can even use MCP to create new tools and expand my abilities.
welcome.signupText: Sign up for an account to get started for free, or use an API key that provides access to models like Claude 3.7 Sonnet.

autoApprove.title: Auto-approve
autoApprove.description: Auto-approve allows Codee to perform the following actions without asking for permission. Please use with caution and only enable if you understand the risks.
autoApprove.maxRequestsDesc: Codee will automatically make this many API requests before asking for approval to proceed with the task.
autoApprove.notificationsDesc: Receive system notifications when Codee requires approval to proceed or when a task is completed.

enableAutoApprove.label: Enable auto-approve
enableAutoApprove.description: Toggle the auto-approve feature on or off.

readFiles.label: Read project files
readFiles.description: Allows Codee to read files within your workspace.

readFilesExternally.label: Read all files
readFilesExternally.description: Allows Codee to read any file on your computer.

editFiles.label: Edit project files
editFiles.description: Allows Codee to modify files within your workspace.

editFilesExternally.label: Edit all files
editFilesExternally.description: Allows Codee to modify any file on your computer.

executeSafeCommands.label: Execute safe commands
executeSafeCommands.description: Allows Codee to execute of safe terminal commands. If the model determines a command is potentially destructive, it will still require approval.

executeAllCommands.label: Execute all commands
executeAllCommands.description: Allows Codee to execute all terminal commands. Use at your own risk.

useBrowser.label: Use the browser
useBrowser.description: Allows Codee to launch and interact with any website in a browser.

useMcp.label: Use MCP servers
useMcp.description: Allows Codee to use configured MCP servers which may modify filesystem or interact with APIs.

enableNotifications.label: Enable notifications
enableNotifications.description: Receive system notifications when Codee requires approval to proceed or when a task is completed.

memorybank.title: Memory bank
memorybank.description: The Memory Bank is a structured documentation system that allows Codee to maintain context across sessions. It transforms Codee from a stateless assistant into a persistent development partner that can effectively "remember" your project details over time.

addServer.title: Add a remote MCP server by providing a name and its URL endpoint. Learn more
addServer.connectingMessage: Connecting to server... This may take a few seconds.

installed.useCommunityMadeServers: enables communication with locally running MCP servers that provide additional tools and resources to extend Codee's capabilities. You can use
installed.createNewMcpServer: or ask Codee to create new tools specific to your workflow (e.g., "add a tool that gets the latest npm docs").

CodeeRules.invalidExtension: Only .md, .txt, or no file extension allowed
CodeeRules.ruleDescription: Rules allow you to provide Codee with system-level guidance. Think of them as a persistent way to include context and preferences for your projects or globally for every conversation.
CodeeRules.workflowsDescription: Workflows allow you to define a series of steps to guide Cline through a repetitive set of tasks, such as deploying a service or submitting a PR. To invoke a workflow, type /workflow-name in the chat.
